user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_BinSemGive:
```c
int32 OS_BinSemGive(osal_id_t sem_id)
{
    OS_object_token_t token;
    int32             return_code;

    /* Check Parameters */
    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_NONE, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, sem_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_BinSemGive_Impl(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_BinSemGive_Impl(&token);
    }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the if-body is reachable at run-time because return_code is assigned from OS_ObjectIdGetById and is not a compile-time constant. When OS_ObjectIdGetById returns OS_SUCCESS the body executes, so there is no unreachable code. (A violation would only occur if the condition were provably always false/true at compile time or the called function could never return OS_SUCCESS, which is not the case here.)
